children.subject: Yeah I don’t think it’s that high... it’s the top third of CS majors, so wouldn’t it be like a 3.7? I’m just not sure, which I’m asking.

Hello Haiming,

i don’t think they publish it—I’m the one who generates the final report—though it is the top 1/3 of majors. I can say that if your cumulative gpa is in the top 1/3 then it doesn’t matter what term you are—you will qualify. I calculate the top 33% of declared CS majors every semester, and it doesn’t matter what term you are in so you would be eligible in spring or even the following fall so long as your overall gpa is in the range. 

The threshold (of course) can vary semester to semester, but I think it’s been ~3.8 or higher the last few semesters. I hope this helps!

If I finished my last class over the summer and declared last month, will I have to wait until the spring semester to be invited to UPE? If so, would that be based on my current GPA (since I already declared), or my GPA after the end of this semester?
Would it be cumulative GPA for all classes or just CS classes?

As I mentioned it would be your cumulative aka overall GPA--definitely *not* just your CS classes. Sorry if I didn't make that clear enough in my message.

To the other questions, I run a report at the beginning of each semester so if you declared after the beginning of the semester then you would have to wait until the next semester's recruiting effort to be eligible. If that's the case they will use what I give them which is the most recent cumulative GPA I have available (meaning your GPA at the *start* of the spring semester).

You can always ask UPE these questions as they're the ones who recruit everyone and are well-versed in this as a student organization matter. In short, I run a report with your most recent overall, cumulative (not just CS) GPA at the start of every semester and tell them who may be recruited based on being in the top 33%. If you miss that cutoff--for example this semester I believe they've already reached out to candidates--then you'd be eligible for review the following semester with one more semester's worth of grades including in your cumulative GPA calculation.

Don't hesitate to let me know if you have any other questions!

Christopher
I've heard that it's around 3.9 or something, but idk how accurate that is

history.content: Does anyone recall the UPE GPA cutoff for the past few semesters? If I finish my last class until declaring this semester, would I be eligible for UPE in the spring?
history.subject: UPE cutoff
